commit.message:
Tweaks and fixes (#29)

* support for pathlib.Path (and black formatting)

* use better way to avoid process window poping up on Windows, not using shell=True

* default wait for ffmpeg, plus better interrupt handling

* fix keyboard interrup propagating to ffmpeg

* fix last commit for unix

* fixed ffmpeg termination after read. Plus comments

* apply same similar stop behavior when reading as when writing

Tweaks and fixes (#29)

* support for pathlib.Path (and black formatting)

* use better way to avoid process window poping up on Windows, not using shell=True

* default wait for ffmpeg, plus better interrupt handling

* fix keyboard interrup propagating to ffmpeg

* fix last commit for unix

* fixed ffmpeg termination after read. Plus comments

* apply same similar stop behavior when reading as when writing

commit.message:
Avoid exception under Cygwin

Cygwin is a hybrid between Windows and Unix.  It does not currently
provide ffmpeg as a package, so the user will have to rely on Windows
builds, such as the [Zeranoe](https://ffmpeg.zeranoe.com/builds/) ones.
Setting winNN can work with such an installation and a suitable path.

Issue: #26
Stopped executable window from flashing on Windows

read_frames hangs on invalid video (#21)

* check if log_catcher is still running

* replace deprecated isAlive to is_alive

* add test on invalid video hanging

* refactor tests' order

* update `_io.py` according black formatting
